headline: Will Nike Investors' Frustrations End Anytime Soon?
summary: If you're a Nike (NYSE: NKE) investor, it wouldn't be surprising if you had a growing sense of frustration owning the stock.  Let's take a closer look at Nike's recent earnings to see if there are any signs of a turnaround in sight for the iconic sneaker and apparel maker.  Nike CEO Elliott Hill has only been on the job for under six months, and finds himself inheriting a difficult situation, looking to turn the company around.

headline: Nike’s Q3 results could weigh on Foot Locker near-term, says Jefferies
summary: Nike’s (NKE) Q3 results were slightly better than expectations but 9% lower year over year, and while the company is returning to its roots, the road to recovery won’t be immediate, which could continue to weigh on near-term performance at Foot Locker (FL), Jefferies analyst Corey Tarlowe tells investors in a research note. Jefferies believes the partnership between Nike and Foot Locker with the “Home Court” and “The Clinic” experiences are encouraging, but sees significant headwinds ahead. Jeff

headline: Nike price target lowered to $75 from $80 at Needham
summary: Needham lowered the firm’s price target on Nike (NKE) to $75 from $80 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The company’s Q4 guidance was worse than expected – revenues are planned down “at the worse end of down mid-teens” with gross margin down 400-500bps, the analyst tells investors in a research note. Nike headwinds are expected to ease in FY26, but the first half of FY26 should remain highly pressured, Needham adds. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving

headline: What Moved Markets This Week
summary: The U.S. stocks snapped a four-week losing streak on Friday as the S&P 500 barely moved into positive territory. Read more about this week's major events on Wall Street.
